column1: The Espionage Act of 1917 has been used to prosecute whistleblowers in the United States including Edward Snowden and Chelsea Manning. In 2013
column2: Manning was convicted of violating the Espionage Act and sentenced to 35 years in prison for leaking sensitive military documents to WikiLeaks. The same year
column3: Snowden was charged with violating the Espionage Act for releasing confidential documents belonging to the NSA.Section 922 of the Dodd–Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act in the United States incentivizes and protects whistleblowers. By Dodd-Frank

column1: 24	Whistleblower: Modern methods used for whistleblower protection	Whistleblowers that may be at risk of those they are exposing are now using encryption methods and anonymous content sharing software to protect their identity. Tor
column2: a highly accessible anonymity network
column3: is one that is frequently used by whistleblowers around the world. Tor has undergone a number of large security updates to protect the identities of potential whistleblowers who may wish to anonymously leak information.Recently specialized whistleblowing software like SecureDrop and GlobaLeaks has been built on top of the Tor technology in order to incentivize and simplify its adoption for secure whistleblowing.
